info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Elbert, southeastern Anderson, Abbeville and northwestern Greenwood Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 648 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles east of Elberton, or near Lake Russell, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Honea Path, Calhoun Falls, Due West, Iva, Lake Secession, Donalds, Cokesbury, Hodges and Lowndesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
